@graph.headline: Building Scalable AI Systems with Modular Prompting
@graph.description: Modular prompting is a technique that structures prompts into distinct segments or modules, each targeting a specific task or behavior. It improves consistency, reusability, and control in large language model outputs by isolating context, instructions, examples, or goals into separate blocks.

@graph.name: Building Scalable AI Systems with Modular Prompting
How to Build Modular Prompts
@graph.description: A step-by-step guide to creating modular prompt architecture for scalable AI systems

supply.name: Text editor or prompt management tool

step.name: Decompose First
step.text: Whiteboard it. Break your big goal into 3-4 distinct sub-tasks. What needs to happen first? What comes next? This is your problem decomposition.

step.name: Create Your First Module
step.text: Make a new text file. Start with the <role> tag. What is the job of this specific step? Then add <input_data> and <requirements>.

step.name: Use Placeholders
step.text: Use curly braces like {placeholder} to mark where data will be injected. This is a core concept in prompt templates.

step.name: Chain it Manually
step.text: Run your first module. Copy the output. Then, in a new conversation, run your second module, pasting the first output into the <input_data> section.

step.name: Build a Library
step.text: Save every module you create. Before you know it, you'll have a personal library of powerful, reusable components.

result.name: Modular prompt system with reusable components

@graph.name: Frequently Asked Questions about Modular Prompting

mainEntity.name: How do structured tags improve prompt explainability?

acceptedAnswer.text: Structured tags like <role> and <requirements> create a clear, self-documenting prompt. When a process fails, you can easily audit the prompt pipeline module by module, checking if the input, rules, and role for a specific step were correct, enhancing explainability immensely.

mainEntity.name: Is a prompt template the same as a prompt module?

acceptedAnswer.text: A prompt template is the core of a module. The template uses placeholders like {input}. A module is the fully structured file (.txt) containing the template plus the critical tags like <role>, <purpose>, and <output_format> that define its function within a larger system.

mainEntity.name: Can you use this modular approach for creative tasks like writing a story?

acceptedAnswer.text: Absolutely. A creative prompt pipeline might include a character-generator.txt module, a plot-outline.txt module, and a chapter-writer.txt module that takes the character and plot as inputs. This step-by-step prompting ensures consistency in a long-form narrative.

mainEntity.name: How does this relate to the concept of neuro-symbolic AI?

acceptedAnswer.text: Modular prompting is a practical step toward the goals of neuro-symbolic AI. The LLM provides the fluid, 'neuro' side of reasoning, while the rigid, structured tags and logical pipeline represent the 'symbolic' framework, creating a hybrid system with both creativity and reliability.
